---
title: "Nick Strayer's CV"
author: Nick Strayer
date: "`r Sys.Date()`"
# These variables determine how the the data is loaded and how the exports are
# done.
params:
  # Is the goal of this knit to build a document that is exported to PDF? 
  # If true: links are turned into footnotes at the end of the document
  pdf: true
  
  # Just the copied URL from the sheet. If using local csv's instead simply put null or 'csvs'
  positions_sheet_loc: "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/14MQICF2F8-vf8CKPF1m4lyGKO6_thG-4aSwat1e2TWc"
 
  # Where will the PDF of this cv be hosted?
  CV_PDF_LOC: "https://github.com/nstrayer/cv/raw/master/strayer_cv.pdf"
  
  # Where will the HTML be hosted?
  CV_HTML_LOC: "nickstrayer.me/cv/"
output:
  pagedown::html_resume:
    css: ['css/cv.css']
    # set it to true for a self-contained HTML page but it'll take longer to render
    self_contained: false
---


```{r, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  results='asis', 
  echo = FALSE
)

library(glue)
library(tidyverse)

# ======================================================================
# A global (gasp) variable that holds all the links that were inserted for
# placement at the end
links <- c()

# ======================================================================
# Now we source two external scripts. One contains functions for building the
# text output and the other loads up our data from either googlesheets or csvs

# Functions for building sections from CSV data
source('parsing_functions.R') 

content_print <- setup_content_printers(pdf_mode = params$pdf)

# Get function to load data for CV/Resume
source('gather_data.R')
data <- gather_data(params$positions_sheet_loc, public_sheet = TRUE)
# public_sheet argument tells function if the sheet available for anyone to read.
# If you're using a private sheet set this to false and go to gather_data.R 
# and run data loading manually once to cache authentication token.
```



```{r}
# When in export mode the little dots are unaligned, so fix that. 
if(params$pdf){
  cat("
  <style>
  :root{
    --decorator-outer-offset-left: -6.5px;
  }
  </style>")
}
```
